Articles.Content:
OK, firstly, I'm not abandoning my other mission report. This is just my RSS stuff.

So I am setting a goal to land a kerbal on Mars and return using RSS without RO.

Ok so let's begin.

- - - Updated - - -

Mars Explorer/Lander

Send a lander and map Mars while in orbit.

Javascript is disabled. View full album

The lander was on an impact course into the planet due to a dumb mistake by me. It impacted Mars at 4000 m/s. Oops

Edited October 11, 2015 by Bev7787

Well, is that rocket insanely overengineered or do you not have RO/SMURFF installed? All you need is a Titan thing to get something to Mars, not a flippin Saturn V with 51 SRBs.

What was that dumb mistake you made on the lander? Lack of parachute? I didn't see one on there. Good luck going to mars! And don't forget to stop by Deimos on the way, Deimos is awesome!
Hahaha you're taking the Add most boosters philosophy quite serious,aren't you?

Yep :-) I don't have RO installed so I took the largest SRB KW Rockety offered and yeah.

- - - Updated - - -

Well, is that rocket insanely overengineered or do you not have RO/SMURFF installed? All you need is a Titan thing to get something to Mars, not a flippin Saturn V with 51 SRBs.

What was that dumb mistake you made on the lander? Lack of parachute? I didn't see one on there. Good luck going to mars! And don't forget to stop by Deimos on the way, Deimos is awesome!

The lander hit the atmo at 7000 m/s while the periapse was below ground. It couldn't slow down fast enough.

Holy balls, this is going to be awesome and hilarious!

>tfw launching a 50+ ton ship to mars in RSS, WITHOUT RO!!!
Yep :-). And you're lucky you haven't seen my Space Station challenge launcher. The manned Mars launcher is going to be a whopper (framerate and boosters)
Might want to start using 20m procedural parts then
ATM broke procedural parts textures so I will have to make them somewhere else. Also that's too ludicrous.
I'm surprised to see this thing even flying, given the aerodynamic resistance and all. Good work.
OK I need a name for the manned Mars mission. Anyone have a suggestion?

Mars Aspiration?

Vida Mars?

Kali III?

Whackjob I? (referencing your rocket)

Spectre?

Hmmmm....

Please stop by Deimos, it takes practically nothing to take off and land on it.

OK, current plan:

Using hydrogen tanks and engines from NFP, we will be heading to Mars, where we will deploy an SAR probe to scan for landing sites and we will land.

A Venus lander probe will be launched as well.

Following this will be a grand tour of the solar system

The crew capsule has already been tested
